channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Supreme Court lets Trump continue to deport Venezuelans under 18th century wartime law—but only after they get a court hearing
item.description: The court’s action appears to bar the administration from immediately resuming the flights that last month carried hundreds of migrants to a notorious...

item.title: Backstabbing is the new office norm: Employees say blame-shifting, snitching, and setting others up to fail are rampant
item.description: Gen Z and millennials are backstabbing their peers to get ahead—but who’s to blame them? Even bosses are playing dirty now that they’re back in the of...

item.title: Trump economic officials revere billionaire Stanley Druckenmiller, but he says he does not support tariffs over 10%
item.description: The administration has disappointed Wall Street amid the stock market’s avoidable tailspin.

item.title: Supreme Court Clears Way for Deportations, and a Stock Market Fake-Out
item.description: Plus, a new push to clone ancient animals.

item.title: With Trump’s Return, Netanyahu Faces Fewer Restraints On Gaza Than Ever
item.description: On the war, President Trump is more aligned than his predecessor with the aims of Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel and his right-wing coali...

item.title: Cracks are beginning to show in the Musk and Trump partnership after Tesla CEO reportedly appealed to White House on tariffs
item.description: Tesla has already spoken out against President Trump's tariffs, and its CEO Elon Musk is now following suit—despite his relationship with the White Ho...

item.title: Shopify CEO tells employees to prove AI can’t do jobs before asking for new hires
item.description: Shopify is going all-in on AI, with CEO Tobi Lütke telling staff that no new hires will be made unless they can prove AI can’t do the job.

item.title: Is Trump Having a Liz Truss Moment?
item.description: Ms. Truss, Britain’s prime minister for 44 days, was forced out after her radical policies caused a market meltdown. But there are some key difference...

item.title: The Global Sell-Off
item.description: We explore the stock market panic over tariffs.

item.title: Israel’s Supreme Court Considers Netanyahu’s Attempt to Fire Spy Chief
item.description: The hearing on the move opened with unruly scenes, as hecklers forced judges to pause the proceedings before resuming them without a public audience.

item.description: The hearing on the move opened with unruly scenes, as hecklers forced judges to pause the proceedings before resuming them without a public audience.

item.title: China Vows to “Fight” Tariffs War With the U.S. “to the End”
item.description: Lin Jian, the spokesman for the Chinese Foreign Ministry, accused the United States of “economic bullying” after President Trump threatened an additio...

item.title: With Trump’s Return, Netanyahu Faces Fewer Restraints On Gaza Than Ever
item.description: On the war, President Trump is more aligned than his predecessor with the aims of Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel and his right-wing coali...

item.title: China Accuses U.S. of Blackmail After Trump Threatens More Tariffs
item.description: China sees little to gain in capitulating to President Trump’s tariff threats, labeling them “blackmail” and vowing to “fight to the end.”
